presentation.use-phone: Hello, I am a nurse.  Do you mind if I use my phone to translate the questions that I'll be asking you?

identity.passport: Can you show me your passport?
identity.id-card: Would I be able to see some ID?
identity.papers-with-name: Would I be able to see some papers with your name on?
identity.european-health-card: Do you have a European health card?
identity.private-insurance: Do you have any private insurance? Do you have your card with you?
identity.cost: The cost of care will not be covered by insurance and you will need to pay in full.
identity.no-cost: The cost of care will be covered by insurance.  You will not need to pay anything.
identity.country-origin: What country do you come from?
identity.phone-number: Do you have a phone number that I can contact you on?

waiting.get-you: We will come and get you.
waiting.prohibitions: No eating, drinking or smoking in the waiting areas.
waiting.family: Your family needs to wait here.
waiting.request: Depending on you status of health, the doctor will sometimes ask for further investigations, like blood tests, radiographies, scans, or they could request to keep you here for observation.
waiting.prohibitions-exams: We ask that you refrain from eating or drinking until otherwise stated by the doctor.  Certain tests require an empty stomach.
waiting.wait-time: You need to wait 1 hour to receive the blood test results.

home.examine: I am going to examine you.
home.pain-scale: On a scale of 1 to 10, can you rate your pain level?
home.undress: Can you please undress so I can examine you?
home.underwear: You can keep your underwear on.
home.sit: You can sit on the chair.
home.lie-1: You can lie on the table.
home.lie-2: You can lie on the stretcher.

background.treatment: Avez-vous un traitement en cours ? lequel ?
background.prescription: Do you have a prescription for your treatment?
background.allergies: Do you have any allergies? What are you allergic to?
background.medical-history: Y a-t-il des antécédents de maladie dans votre famille ?

neurology.day: Do you know what day it is?
neurology.where: Do you know where you are?
neurology.move-hand: Can you move your hands and feet?
neurology.touch-hand: I am going to touch you hands and feet.  Do you feel it?
neurology.look-eyes: Look me in the eyes.  I want to observe your pupils.
neurology.pins-and-needles: Do you have any pins and needles?  Show me where.
neurology.pain-neck: Do you have any pain in the neck?
neurology.blood-sugar-level: I am going to prick the end of your finger to check your blood sugar level.

pneumology.breathe: I am going to put my hand on your stomach to check your breathing.  Just breathe normally and don't talk
pneumology.deep-breathe: Take a deep breath in and hold it.
pneumology.asthma-medication: Have you taken your asthma medication?
pneumology.breath-smoke: Have you breathed in any type of smoke?
pneumology.blow-nose: Can you please blow your nose so I can see I there is any soot?

cardiology.pain-referring: The pain is referring to my:
cardiology.how-long: Depuis combien de temps avez vous cette douleur ?
cardiology.pulse: I am going to take your pulse.
cardiology.press-nail: I am going to press lightly on your nail.
cardiology.blood-pressure: I am going to take your blood pressure.
cardiology.lift-tongue: Open your mouth and lift your tongue.  I am going to give you some medication.
cardiology.medication-help: Est ce que ce médicament soulage votre douleur ?
cardiology.record-heart: I am going to record your heart.  It won't hurt, but try and avoid moving for several seconds.

faintness.what-during-dizzy: What did you experience during the dizzy spell?
faintness.where-pain: A quel endroit avez-vous ressenti ces signes ?
faintness.how-long-dizzyness: Combien de temps à duré votre malaise ?
faintness.bite-tongue: Vous êtes-vous mordu la langue ? Ouvrez la bouche

digestive.pain-spread: Does the pain spread elsewhere?  Where to?
digestive.lost-weight: Have you lost any weight in the last few months?  How many kilos?
digestive.burning-urine: Avez-vous des brûlures quand vous urinez ?
digestive.blood-urine: Have you noticed any blood in your urine?
digestive.last-urine: When was the last time you urinated today?
digestive.diarrhea: Have you had any bouts of diarrhea?
digestive.blood-stool: Have you noticed any blood in your stool?
digestive.rectal-exam: I need to do a rectal exam.  Are you ok with that?
digestive.urinate-jar: You need to urinate in this jar so we can test it.
digestive.wash-genitals: You'll need to wash your genitals before urinating in the jar.

infectious.bitten: Have you been bitten or stung?
infectious.where-spots: Show me where the first spots appeared.
infectious.how-long-leg: For how long has the leg been red?
infectious.remain-isolation: You need to remain in isolation.
infectious.mask: You need to keep this mask on.
infectious.unprotected-sex: Have you had any unprotected sex?
infectious.temperature: I am going to take your temperature.

ophthalmology.room-spinning: Do you feel as though the room is spinning?
ophthalmology.hiy-head: Have you been hit in the head recently?

pediatrics.baby-weight: Has the baby lost any weight?  How much?
pediatrics.vaccinations: Is the baby up-to-date with his/her vaccinations?
pediatrics.upset: Does he/she seem more upset than normal?
pediatrics.tired: Does he/she seem more tired than usual?

gynecology.blood-color: Was the blood red or black?
gynecology.problems-pregnancy: Did you have any problems during your last pregnancy?
gynecology.baby-moving: Do you feel the baby moving?
gynecology.gynecologic-exam: I need to do a gynacological exam.  Can you please lie on the table?
gynecology.underwear: You need to remove your underwear.

traumatology.thrown: Were you thrown from the vehicle?
traumatology.height-fall: From what height did you fall?
traumatology.anticoagulants: Do you take any anticoagulants or any medication to thin the blood?
traumatology.neck-brace: I am going to give you a neck brace to protect your spine.
traumatology.antiseptic: I need to add some antiseptic solution to the wound.
traumatology.stitch-up: I need to stitch up the wound.
traumatology.dressing: I need to apply a dressing.
traumatology.local-anesthesic: I am going to give you a local anaesthetic for your wound.
traumatology.cast: I am going to have to place you in a cast.

examination.drip: I am going to put you on a drip.
examination.take-blood: I am going to take some blood.
examination.dessing2: I am going to apply a dressing.
examination.injection: I am going to give you an injection.
examination.wash: I am going to give you a wash down/sponge bath.
examination.shower-before: You need to take a shower and wash your hair before the operation.
examination.remove-jewellry: You need to remove your jewellry and piercings.
examination.remove-polish: You need to remove your nail polish.
examination.remove-dentures: You need to remove your dentures and hearing aids.

treatments.remain-back: You must remain lying on your back.
treatments.lights: To turn on or turn off the lights, press here.

conclusion.fracture: You have a fracture/He or she has a fracture.
conclusion.no-fracture: You don't have a fracture/He or she doesn't have a fracture.
conclusion.come-tomorrow: You need to come back tomorrow.
conclusion.come-back: You need to come back in:
conclusion.stitches-remove: Vous devrez faire retirer les fils dans
conclusion.go-hospital: You need to go to the hospital.
conclusion.stay-hospital: You need to stay in hospital.
conclusion.transferred: You are going to be transferred to another department.

others.nous-navons-pas-trouve-ce-pays-merci-de-: Nous n'avons pas trouvé ce pays. Merci de verifier l'orthographe
others.tralelho-traductions-pour-les-etrangers-: Tralelho - Traductions pour les Etrangers à l'Hopital
others.pour-entrer-dans-la-salle-dirm-il-faut-r: Pour entrer dans la salle d’IRM, il faut retirer tout objet métallique (appareils dentaires et auditifs, montre, bijoux...)
others.une-perfusion-va-vous-etre-posee-pour-in: Une perfusion va vous être posée pour injecter un produit de contraste au cours de l’examen
others.il-faudra-rester-immobile-pendant-tout-l: Il faudra rester immobile pendant tout l’examen
others.lexamen-est-long-il-dure-entre-15-et-40-: L'examen est long. Il dure entre 15 et 40 minutes. L'examen n'est pas douloureux mais il est très bruyant
others.durant-lexamen-on-vous-demandera-de-gonf: During the scan/examination, we will ask you to breath in deeply and keep your lungs filled with air.
others.avez-vous-une-chambre-implantable: a PICC line (Peripherally Inserted Central Catheter)
others.allaitez-vous: Are you breastfeeding? Do you breastfeed?
others.avez-vous-des-clips-chirurgicaux-intra-c: Avez-vous des clips chirurgicaux intra crâniens (CI avant 1992)?
others.avez-vous-des-eclats-metalliques-dans-le: Do you have metal shards in your eyes ?
others.si-oui-avez-vous-une-carte-avec-les-refe: If yes, do you have a card containing the equipment reference numbers?
others.il-faudra-retirer-tout-objet-metallique-: Il faudra retirer tout objet métallique (appareils dentaires et auditifs)
others.une-perfusion-va-vous-etre-posee-pour-in: Une perfusion va vous être posée pour injecter un produit de contraste au cours de l’examen. L’injection de ce produit de contraste peut donner une sensation de chaleur dans tout le corps
others.avez-vous-des-allergies-au-produit-de-co: Avez-vous des allergies au produit de contraste?
others.avez-vous-une-insuffisance-ou-maladie-re: Avez-vous une insuffisance ou maladie rénale?
others.prenez-vous-un-traitement-pour-la-thyroi: Are you following a treatment for thyroid?
others.cliquez-sur-une-phrase-pour-lafficher: Cliquez sur une phrase pour l'afficher
others.est-ce-que-votre-douleur-irradie-montrez: Is your pain referring to any other part of your body?  Can you show me where?
others.depuis-combien-de-temps-avez-vous-cette-: How long have you experienced this pain?
others.vous-etes-vous-mordu-la-langue-ouvrez-la: Vous êtes-vous mordu la langue ? Ouvrez la bouche
others.avez-vous-des-brulures-quand-vous-urinez: Have you experienced any burning sensation when urinating?
others.y-a-t-il-des-antecedents-de-maladie-dans: Do you have any family medical history?
others.jai-urine-je-voudrais-etre-change: I wet myself (I would like to be changed).
others.je-voudrais-uriner: I need to go and urinate.
others.je-voudrais-defequer: I need to pass a bowel movement.
others.je-voudrais-etre-reinstalle: I would like to move rooms.
others.jetais-en-voiture: I was in the car/I was driving.
others.je-roulais-a-x-km-h: I was riding at XX km/h.
others.je-navais-pas-de-ceinture-de-securite: I didn't have my seatbelt on.
others.jai-ete-ejecte-pendant-laccident: I was thrown from the car during the accident.
others.je-nai-pas-ete-ejecte-pendant-laccident: I wasn't thrown from the car during the accident.
others.lair-bag-ne-sest-pas-declenche: The air bag was not deployed.
others.jetais-en-velo: I was riding the bike./I was on my bike.
others.jetais-en-scooter: I was riding the scooter./I was on my scooter.
others.jetais-en-moto: I was riding the motorbike./I was on my motorbike.
others.je-navais-pas-de-casque: I didn't have a helmet on.
others.je-suis-tombe-de-ma-hauteur: I fell from the same height as me.
others.je-suis-tombe-de-x-metres-de-hauteur: I fell from XX metres high.
others.ma-tete-a-tape-pendant-laccident: I hit my head in the accident.
others.ma-tete-na-pas-tape-pendant-laccident: My head was not hit in the accident.
others.je-prend-des-anticoagulants-medicaments-: I take anticoagulants to thin my blood.
others.jai-des-douleurs-depuis: I have been in pain since:
others.jarrive-bien-a-bouger-mes-bras-et-jambes: I can easily move my arms and legs.
others.je-narrive-pas-a-bouger-un-bras-ou-une-j: I can't move my arms or legs.
others.la-lumiere-me-derange: The light annoys me/Light annoys me.
others.la-lumiere-ne-me-derange-pas: The light doesn't annoy me/Light doesn't annoy me.
others.jai-des-douleurs-a-la-nuque: the back of my neck hurts.
others.je-nai-pas-de-douleurs-a-la-nuque: The back of my neck doesn't hurt.
others.je-nai-pas-fais-de-malaise: I didn't have a dizzy spell.
others.je-nai-pas-pris-mes-traitements-aujourdh: I didn't take my medication today.
others.jai-eu-un-choc-au-torse-recemment: I got hit in the torso recently.
others.je-nai-pas-eu-de-choc-au-torse-recemment: I wasn't hit in the torso recently.
others.la-douleur-nest-plus-presente: The pain is no longer there.
others.je-ne-ressent-pas-de-palpitations: I am not having any palpitations.
others.dans-ma-famille-il-y-a-des-problemes-car: My family has a history of cardiac problems.
others.dans-ma-famille-il-ny-a-pas-de-probleme-: My family has no history of cardiac problems.
others.la-douleur-est-plus-forte-quand-je-respi: The pain is stronger when I inhale.
others.la-douleur-nest-pas-plus-forte-quand-je-: The pain is not stronger when I inhale.
others.je-nai-pas-de-difficultes-a-respirer: I am not having any trouble breathing.
others.il-y-avait-du-sang-dans-mes-urines: The was blood in my urine.
others.il-ny-avait-pas-de-sang-dans-mes-urines: There was no blood in my urine.
others.je-nai-pas-de-brulures-quand-jurine: It doesn't burn when I urinate.
others.il-y-avait-du-sang-dans-mes-selles: There was blood in my stool.
others.il-ny-avait-pas-de-sang-dans-mes-selles: There was no blood in my stool.
others.jai-eu-des-pertes-par-voie-basse: I had blood loss during vaginal delivery/natural birth.
others.je-nai-pas-eu-de-perte-par-voie-basse: I had no blood loss during vaginal delivery/natural birth.
others.je-nai-pas-perdu-de-poids-ces-derniers-t: I have not lost weight recently.
others.ma-douleur-nirradie-pas-vers-la-fesse-ou: The pain doesn't refer to anywhere else.
others.ma-douleur-irradie-vers-la-fesse-ou-la-j: The pain refers down into my backside/down my leg.
others.jai-mal-surtout-le-soir: I feel sick especially at night.
others.jai-mal-surtout-le-matin: I feel sick, especially in the morning.
others.jai-recu-un-coup-recemment: I received a knock recently/I was hit recently.
others.je-nai-pas-recu-de-coup-recemment: I have not been hit/received any blows recently.
others.jai-besoin-de-secours-pouvez-vous-les-ap: I need (medical) assistance, could you please call an ambulance?
others.lexamen-est-long-il-dure-entre-15-et-40-: The scan takes a long time. About 15 to 40 minutes in total.
others.lexamen-nest-pas-douloureux-mais-il-est-: The scan isn’t painful but it is very loud.
others.il-faut-rester-immobile-pendant-toute-la: You must remain still during the entire scan
others.quelle-est-votre-taille-et-votre-poids: What is your height and weight
others.nous-allons-injecter-un-produit-de-contr: We will inject you with intravenous dye which will create a warm feeling in your body. This reaction is normal and you should not worry about it.
others.pouvez-vous-signer-lautorisation-de-soin: Could you please sign the authorization for medical treatment ?
